justification: "Participants completed some or all of the following personality inventories: the Behavioral Inhibition/Activation Scales (BIS/BAS)…"

measured_by: Neuroticism subscale of the NEO Five Factor Inventory
justification: The article states that participants completed "the Neuroticism subscale of the NEO Five Factor Inventory" at the start of the experiment.
The methods section lists the "Intolerance for Uncertainty Scale" among the personality inventories administered to measure this construct.
It is reported that participants filled out the "Need for Cognition" inventory, indicating this construct was measured by that scale.

measured_by: 5-point stress/anxiety rating scale for each choice set
justification: "In Phase 3, participants… rated… how stressed/anxious they had felt when facing each set… Each of these experiences was rated on a 5-point scale."
Phase 1 had participants "evaluate each product on a computerized visual analog liking scale, anchored at 0 ('not at all') and 10 ('a great deal')."
In Phase 4, "Participants re-rated each product… on a bipolar scale, anchored at −10 ('dislike a great deal') and 10 ('like a great deal')."

measured_by: Auction-style WTP procedure (indicating dollars given up out of $20)
justification: Study 2 describes that participants "were asked to indicate how much of this money they would give up to obtain that trial's product," implementing a willingness-to-pay measure of value.
